page.title: 01THE PARISH OF POLWARTH
page.content: THIS PART OF THE PARISH OF POLWARTH IS A WELL WOODED AREA OF GOOD FARMING LAND, BORDERED ON THE NORTH WEST BY GREENLAW MOOR WHICH, AT THE QUARRY OF KYLE'S HILL RISES TO A HEIGHT OF 285 METRES. THE ANCIENT VILLAGE OF POLWARTH, LYING HALF A MILE FROM POLWARTH KIRK, ON THE A 6105 BETWEEN DUNS AND GREENLAW, GAVE ITS NAME TO THE PEERAGE WHICH IS STILL EXTANT AND TO THE THORN, IMMORTALIZED IN FOLKLORE, WHICH IS STILL IN EXISTENCE. NOW IT ONLY HAS THREE OCCUPIED HOUSES, THE MAIN CENTRE OF HABITATION BEING AT MARCHMONT AND THE FARMS OF WOODHEADS AND SISTERPATH, APART FROM TWO MANSES AT POLWARTH RHODES AND THE OLD POLWARTH MANSE AND THE OLD MARCHMONT STATION. THE LAND IS VERY FERTILE & IS WATERED BY A NUMBER OF BURNS & SPRINGS & BEARS A WIDE RANGE OF FLORA & FAUNA.
